H0.text: The mesosphere is the atmospheric layer in which the summit of Mount Everest, where temperature decreases as altitude increases, is located.

H1.text: The summit of Mount Everest, where temperature decreases as altitude increases, is located in the stratosphere.

H2.text: Thermosphere is the atmospheric layer in which the summit of Mount Everest is located, given that temperature decreases as altitude increases.

H3.text: The summit of Mount Everest is in the troposphere, the atmospheric layer in which temperature decreases as altitude increases.

A4.text: The troposphere is the atmospheric layer in which temperature decreases as altitude increases.
